subSubSection.paragraph:

: 1 specimen ( IEBR-Chi 068 ) Ta Xua Natural Reserve , natural forests, 21.3447N– 104.6981E , elevation of
507 m
,
10 February 2017
, coll. Ha Kieu Loan & Le X. Son
;

ince :

347 m

, coll. Hoang N. Anh & Nguyen D. Hung

, coll. Le X. Son
;
6 specimens ( IEBR-Chi 194–199 ) Kon Chu Rang Natural Reserve ( 14.4744N– 108.5405N ), natural forests,

, coll. Le X. Son ;

:
2 specimens ( IEBR-Chi 131, 134 ) Chu Yang Sin National Park ( 12.3037N– 108.3800E ), natural forests,
10 June 2015
, coll. Le X. Son.

Diagnosis . Body with 21 leg-bearing segments. Spiracles oval-shaped ( Fig. 29C ). Antennae with 21 antennomeres; first two and of the third glabrous ( Fig. 28 ). Coxosternal plate with 4–5 teeth, lateral pair clearly isolated and fused to a varying degree ( Fig. 28D ). Tergites 3–20 with 5–7 longitudinal sutures, without paramedian grooves; sternite with barely visible, incomplete, paramedian grooves ( Fig. 29 A–B). Coxopleural process long, conical, with 2–3 very tiny apical spines, and 2–3 lateral spines ( Figs 29D , 30A ). Prefemur of ultimate legs with large spines arranged in rows ( Fig. 30 B–C).

Previous records in Vietnam
. HAI PHONG , QUANG BINH , DA NANG , GIA LAI , LAM DONG , DONG NAI ( Schileyko 1992 , 1995 , 2007 ; Attems 1938 , 1953 ).
Distribution . Japan , China , Taiwan , Laos , Thailand , Myanmar , Indonesia , Malaysia , Hawaiian Islands, Russia ( Attems 1930 , 1953 ; Lewis 2001 ; Chao & Chang 2003 ; Schileyko 2007 ).
Remarks . The species seems to be widely distributed in Vietnam ( Fig. 31 ).
